FuncDef:
The isis ipv6 ti-lfa disable command disables TI-LFA on an IPv6 IS-IS interface.
The undo isis ipv6 ti-lfa disable command enables TI-LFA on an IPv6 IS-IS interface.
By default, IPv6 TI-LFA is enabled automatically on IS-IS interfaces if the ti-lfa command is run in the IS-IS IPv6-FRR view.
CLIs: isis ipv6 ti-lfa disable [ level-1 | level-2 | level-1-2 ]
undo isis ipv6 ti-lfa disable [ level-1 | level-2 | level-1-2 ]

ParaDef.Info:
Enables or disables TI-LFA on an IPv6 IS-IS Level-1 interface.
-

Enables or disables TI-LFA on an IPv6 IS-IS Level-2 interface.
-

Enables or disables TI-LFA on all IPv6 IS-IS interfaces.
If no level is specified, TI-LFA is disabled by default on all IS-IS interfaces.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the ti-lfa command is run in the IS-IS IPv6-FRR view, TI-LFA is automatically enabled on all IPv6 IS-IS interfaces. To disable TI-LFA on a specified interface, run the isis ipv6 ti-lfa disable command in the interface view.
Precautions
If the ti-lfa command is not run, the isis ipv6 ti-lfa disable command can be run but cannot take effect on an interface.
If the isis ipv6 ti-lfa disable and ti-lfa commands are run in sequence, the isis ipv6 ti-lfa disable command still takes effect.
If an interface is bound to a VPN instance, the interface does not support TI-LFA.
